thread.title: ASUS launches ZenFone Go at Rs 7,999 | Deccan Chronicle
thread.title_full: ASUS launches ZenFone Go at Rs 7,999 | Deccan Chronicle

author: Deccan
title: ASUS launches ZenFone Go at Rs 7,999 | Deccan Chronicle
text:
Deccan Chronicle | September 23, 2015, 13.59 pm You can expand the storage capacity of this handset up to 64GB ASUS has launched the ZenFone Go, a 3G-enabled smartphone on Flipkart, priced at Rs 7,999 for the Indian market. Featuring a 5-inch display, ZenFone Go comes with a pixel density of 294ppi and offers 8GB of storage.
This handset runs on Android 5.1 Lollipop and its storage capacity can also be expanded up to 64GB via microSD card. ZenFone Go also offers 100GB of Google Drive storage, free for 2 years. On its camera front, Zenfone Go sports 8MP Autofocus rear camera and 2MP of front-facing camera.
The Zenfone Go also offers other features like ZenUI, ZenMotion, Trend Micro, Dr. Safety and ZenUI Instant Updates. The ZenFone Go handset will be available in three colours - Black, White and Red.
